vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/4a576542-3bb8-41ba-bb5c-e428c92a58ef">WORKERS</keyword>         <topcClas>Economic conditions and indicators - Economics</topcClas>         <topcClas>General - Employment and labour</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The OECD Employment and Labour Market Statistics provide detailed annual information the employment and labour market for the period 1950/60 onwards for all OECD countries (where data is available). <br> The OECD Employment and Labour Market Statistics includes a range of annual labour market statistics and indicators broken down by sex and age as well as information about part-time and short-time workers, job tenure, hours worked, unemployment duration, trade union, employment protection legislation, minimum wages, labour market programmes for OECD countries and non-member economies.<br> These data were first provided by the UK Data Service in February 2015. The UK Data Service web site includes further information on its OECD Employment and Labour Market Statistics holdings, including a <a href="http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/use-data/guides/dataset/labour-statistics.aspx" title="OECD Employment and Labour Market Statistics dataset user guide">dataset user guide</a> and details of <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/labour/2015-01" title="OECD Employment and Labour Market Statistics latest database updates">latest database updates</a>.<br> <br> Citation: The bibliographic citation for the database is: Organisation for Economic Cooperation and Development ({YYYY}):  Employment and Labour Market Statistics ({Ed. Data download: YYYY-MM}). UK Data Service. DOI: {edition specific doi - e.g. <a href="http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/labour/2015-01" title="DOI: http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/labour/2015-01">DOI: http://dx.doi.org/10.5257/oecd/labour/2015-01</a>}.  <br> <br> Alternative DOIs: 10.1787/lfs-data-en (to access via OECD.Stat subscription).<br> </abstract>       <abstract><B>Main
